subject: Sleep
title: Coffee and the Sleep Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of Coffee and the Sleep Revolution for builders.

hook.text: Coffee arrived in Europe in the 1600s and transformed society from a sleepy, beer-drinking culture into a wired one.

buildup.text: Before coffee, the main breakfast drink was beer. People started the day mildly drunk, not caffeinated.

discovery.text: Coffeehouses became centers of innovation. The Enlightenment, insurance industry, and stock markets were born in them.

twist.text: Coffee allowed humans to override sleep pressure for the first time, enabling longer work hours and night shifts.

climax.text: Today, 85 percent of adults consume caffeine daily. It is the world's most widely used psychoactive drug.

punchline.text: Coffee didn't just wake people up. It rewrote civilization's relationship with sleep.

quiz.question: What did coffee replace as the main breakfast drink in Europe?
